result.title: Problem alias data for codeforces
result.content:
In codeforces, one problem may have multiple problem ids. As a result, when building tools, it may lead to some bugs(like incorrectly determine whether a user has solved a problem). I didn't find any published data on it, so I fetched one and want to share it in case it is useful.

You can download the data at https://dl4.tempdomain.ml/cfprob.json. The data is a json array, key is the problem id of a problem, value is the problem id in problemset. For example:

{
"780F": "780F",
"781D": "780F",
"782F": "780F"
}

means problem 780F, 781D and 782F are the same, and the problem id in problemset is 780F.

Based on this data, I've built a small tool which can search for unsolved problems (It will also include the problems that one tried in contests but not in practice mode, which aren't shown in the codeforces problemset.) or find the aliases of a problem. It's available at: https://dl4.tempdomain.ml/cf-unsolved.php
